intro: Campanula biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Campanula biflora is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
